bibliography: [various articles on the text of Pindar]; B. Snell - H. Maehler, Pindari Carmina cum fragmentis II, pap. 30; M.S Funghi - G. Messeri Savorelli, SCO 42 (1992), p. 43-62.
author: anon.
contents: marginal scholia on works by Pindar (Dithyrambs ? others ?), with one minor mythological reference to Atalante (fr. 8).
statepreservation: 32 fragments, mostly small; fr. 8 has scanty remains of 5 lines of scholia.
lectionalsigns: accents; breathings; apostrophes; trema (several); quantity marks; high stops; paragraphos (one straight and one forked) to separate scholia; ?-sign and diplê (fr. 19); several corrections; iota adscript.
hand: small, informal, mixed round, sligthly flattened, leaning forward, markedly bilinear, regular, competently and carefully written, mostly separating the letters, with occasional serifs, belonging to the "scribo di Pindaro" (Funghi-Messeri Savorelli); the scholia are written by the same hand in tiny letters.
